meanings.definition: (ポルトガル語) poder の接続法未来形の一人称または三人称単数形
meanings.english_definition: (Portuguese) First or third-person singular future subjunctive of the verb 'poder' (to be able to, can).

examples.translation: If I were able to, I would help.
When he is able to, he will come.

collocations: se eu podre (if I were able)
quando ele podre (when he is able)

etymology.value: From the Latin 'potere', meaning 'to be able'.

usage_notes.explanation: The future subjunctive in Portuguese is primarily used in subordinate clauses expressing hypothetical or future conditions. It is less common in modern spoken Portuguese, often replaced by the infinitive or present subjunctive.

examples.note: 'Podre' is not used in the present indicative. Use 'posso' instead.
In the conditional clause, use the future subjunctive 'podre', not the conditional 'poderia'.

readability_explanation.text: The future subjunctive form 'podre' is an advanced grammatical concept in Portuguese. Its usage is relatively formal and less frequent in everyday speech. Understanding its function requires a solid grasp of Portuguese subjunctive moods and conditional sentence structures.

example_sentences.sentence: Se você podre vir, será bem-vindo.
example_sentences.translation: If you are able to come, you will be welcome.

example_sentences.sentence: Quando eu podre pagar, eu pagarei.
example_sentences.translation: When I am able to pay, I will pay.

example_sentences.sentence: Caso ele podre resolver o problema, ele será promovido.
example_sentences.translation: If he is able to solve the problem, he will be promoted.
